Incident.Summary: 2 veh accident, DUI, RESISTING ARREST MDOP, 2ND DEGREE ASSAULT, DISORERLY CONDUCT

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
*********INCIDENT CAPTURED ON MSP ISSUED BODY WORN CAMERA*********

            On 01/08/2023 at approximately 2226 hours I was dispatched by the Maryland State College Park Barrack to Northbound Branch Avenue at Moore’s Road for a two vehicle collision. Upon my arrival, I identified the driver of the at fault vehicle by her Maryland driver’s license as Yushikia Tomikia Barnhardt (DOB: 08/16/1984 B/F).
             I approached Barnhardt, I detected a strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath, as well as bloodshot eyes. I requested Barnhardt to submit to Standardized Field Sobriety Testing once backup had arrived, in which she refused.
Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus – Barnhardt refused to submit to any tests.
Walk and Turn – Barnhardt refused to submit to any tests.
One Leg Stand – Barnhardt refused to submit to any tests.

    While attempting to place Barnhardt under arrest, Barnhardt resisted several times by turning her shoulders away from myself as well as other troopers. Barnhardt was arrested at 2307 hours on 01/08/2023. Once placed in my patrol vehicle, Barnhardt then began kicking the windshield of my patrol vehicle while seated in the front passenger seat, subsequently causing the window to break in an approximate 12 inch “spider web” shape. Barnhardt was then transported to the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack, where she elected to listen to an English audio recording of the DR15 which was played aloud in the barrack. At approximately 2351 hours, Barnhardt refused to take the Intoximeter examination test. Barnhardt was provided with a copy of the DR15 and DR15a.
 
While at the barrack, Barnhardt attempted to flee the processing room, where she was stopped by Senior Trooper Murray #5466. Barnhardt then fell to the ground, locking both of her legs around Senior Trooper Murray, causing him to fall. Barnhardt was then transported to Bowie Health Center to be evaluated. After being placed in my patrol vehicle, Barnhardt then unbuckled her seatbelt, opened the door and attempted to exit the vehicle. Barnhardt then slid her body from the front passenger seat of my patrol vehicle, onto the floorboard. Master Trooper Batty #4753 attempted to assist Barnhardt back into the seat, in which Barnhardt the kicked Master Trooper Batty in the lower leg area several times. While at the hospital, Barnhardt continued to shout and curse profanities, so much that an attorney, who was also a patient, stepped out of her room while in a hospital gown, advising Barnhardt that her best option was to “relax and remain silent”. While leaving Bowie Health Center, Barnhardt then fell to the ground, refusing to get up. After being assisted to stand up, Barnhardt was placed back into my patrol vehicle to be taken to the Department of Corrections. While traveling Southbound on Route 301, myself and several troopers had to stop approximately six separate times due to Barnhardt’s actions while in my patrol vehicle. These actions included kicking the dash, throwing her body back and forth violently, urinating in the vehicle, unbuckling her seatbelt, and attempting to slide out from underneath the seatbelt. During processing, Barnhardt was very uncooperative.

All events occurred in Prince George’s County, Maryland.

********* INCIDENT CAPTURED ON MSP ISSUED BODY WORN CAMERA *********

On 1/8/2023 at approximately 2307hrs, Trooper Hershberger was dispatched to a collision and subsequently arrested Yushikia Barnhardt for DUI/DWI. During the arrest and processing, Barnhardt was allegedly uncooperative, and then also resisted arrest passively and actively/physically. She also allegedly caused intentional damage to Trooper Hershberger's patrol vehicle during the arrest. I came on duty at approximately 2300hrs, and was asked by Sgt. Bolduc (MSP Forestville duty officer) to report to MSP Forestville to assist with the arrest. I was directed to help transport Barnhardt to Bowie Health Medical Center for medical clearance (due to her involvement in a collision), and then to transport her to the Upper Marlboro Detention Center.

Inside MSP Forestville, I found Barnhardt on the lower level by the processing room. Barnhardt was handcuffed to the rear and was continuously talking/yelling and appeared to be trying to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate the other trooper's that were in the immediate area. She continued to threaten that she would bring lawsuit against myself and other trooper's and would have us fired from our jobs. She wreaked of an alcoholic beverage, especially when she spoke. Due to her previous actions, I retrieved the barrack's prisoner transport shackles, and placed them on Barnhardt for her safety and the safety of other trooper's involved. Barnhardt was then escorted out to Trooper Hershberger's patrol vehicle for transport to Bowie Health. While assisting Barnhardt into the front passenger seat, she kicked me in the lower legs several times (no injury) in protest and in an attempt to get out of the patrol vehicle. She resisted being seatbelted and eventually moved her body out of the seat and into the open door area where I was standing. Barnhardt continued to attempt to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate myself and other trooper's at the scene, and began making comments that she would only listen/comply with an officer that was the same race as her, as she stated she was afraid that other officer's would hurt or kill her during transport.

Eventually, with the assistance of two officer's of the same race as Barnhardt, she eventually complied and was seated in the front seat of Trooper Hershberger's patrol vehicle. At some point prior to leaving MSP Forestville, Barnhardt unbuckled her own seatbelt and opened her door to try to escape. However she was stopped. A caged patrol vehicle was requested at some point, but apparently none were available, even from surrounding agencies. To prevent Barnhardt from trying to get out of the vehicle again, another trooper rode in Trooper Hershberger's patrol vehicle and sat behind Barnhardt to prevent her from taking her seatbelt off or opening the door. I then followed Trooper Hershberger (followed by several other trooper's) to Bowie Health. After arriving and entering the building, Barnhardt continued yelling and attempting to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate myself and other trooper's that was escorting her. Numerous times Barnhardt was asked/told to stop yelling for the sake of other hospital patients, but she continued. Eventually, hospital staff conducted their interview with Barnhardt and concluded that she was medically cleared to be taken to the Upper Marlboro Detention Center.

While exiting the hospital at the rear entrance, Barnhardt protested being taken to jail by collapsing onto the floor, even while  myself and another trooper were holding each of her arms. Barnhardt was lowered safely all the way to the floor and was allowed to lay where she dropped while I spoke to her. Eventually, Barnhardt allowed me and another trooper to lift her off of the ground and bring her outside to Trooper Hershberger's patrol vehicle. Again, just as before,  Barnhardt resisted being placed into the patrol vehicle and continued yelling and attempting to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate myself and other trooper's that were escorting her. Eventually, we gained compliance and Barnhardt was seatbelted in the patrol vehicle with another trooper seated behind her.

Eventually, we all left Bowie Medical and began driving towards the Upper Marlboro Detention Center. While driving, several times, Trooper Hershberger had to stop his vehicle due to the erratic and resistant behavior of Barnhardt inside his vehicle. Each time, Barnhardt continued yelling and attempting to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate myself and other trooper's that were escorting her. Each time, she was reminded that she was only extending the transport and that we would patiently wait for her voluntary compliance and submission to the arrest. Barnhardt, eventually, became compliant enough that the transport was continued.

Eventually, we all arrived at the Upper Marlboro Detention Center and Barnhardt was taken inside for booking/processing. While inside she continued yelling attempting to verbally control/intimidate/manipulate myself and other trooper's that was escorting her. She continued the same conduct with detention center staff and was released into their custody shortly thereafter.

All events occurred in Prince George’s County, Maryland.

INCIDENT CAPTURED ON MSP ISSUED BODY WORN CAMERA.

On 01/08/2023 at approximately 2226 hours, I arrived and assisted on a two-vehicle collision on northbound MD Rte 5 at Moores Road, Brandywine, Prince George’s County MD. Upon arrival, I observed a Nissan Altima and Buick Verano disabled in the roadway. Trooper Hershberger #7444 was on the scene and in charge of the incident. I observed Trooper Hershberger #7444 attempting to conduct Standardized Field Sobriety Tests, which Barnhardt refused. I observed her turned her shoulders and hands away after refusing to place her hands behind her back. She was subsequently placed under arrest for DUI. Barnhardt was highly inebriated, she was yelling and shouting profanities before and after being placed in the patrol vehicle. While seated in the patrol vehicle, I observed Barnhardt used her feet to kick and break the Maryland State Police Patrol vehicle windshield. Barnhardt's feet were retrained, and she was transported to MSP Forestville Barrack for processing.

While at the MSP Forestville Barrack, I was tasked with observing and watching Barnhardt. Prior to transporting Barnhardt to Bowie Health Hospital for an evaluation, Barnhardt dropped to the floor and used her legs to lock both of my legs. I de-escalated the situation by calmly asking Barnhardt to release her legs from mine. Barnhardt refused to released her legs. I was assisted by several other Troopers by pulling her legs away from mine which caused me to fall down. Barnhardt continued to yell stating she was in fear of her life. She shouted profanities and her legs were subdued by the Barrack leg shackles by M/T Batty #4753.

All events occurred in Prince George's County Maryland.
